body_html:
I'm suspecting it's because of this https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THC/THCTensorMathReduce.cuh#L30-L32
I have default constructor initializing values, which is intended to be used here: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensorMathReduce.cu#L95

But I can't figure out how this becomes a static __shared__ variable: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THC/THCReduce.cuh#L161
Moreover, how is this only a warning but not an error.

Let me first try to remove the assignment in the default constructor and see if it get rid of all those warning.

body:
I'm suspecting it's because of this https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THC/THCTensorMathReduce.cuh#L30-L32
I have default constructor initializing values, which is intended to be used here: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensorMathReduce.cu#L95

But I can't figure out how this becomes a `static __shared__ variable`: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THC/THCReduce.cuh#L161
Moreover, how is this only a warning but not an error.

Let me first try to remove the assignment in the default constructor and see if it get rid of all those warning.
